posts.name: Brian Weiss
posts.cooked:
Our team is currently using PathPlanner to run Choreo paths, and the constructor looks like this:

Where the way for us to get a command in Choreo is through this function:

With: autoChooser.setDefaultOption(“Choreo 1Auto”, driveSub.ChoreoAuto(“Top Left 1 Coral”));

Where this is the Choreo path: image 1606×1028 65.1 KB Run on blue alliance we get this result: image 1130×878 67.1 KB But on Red alliance we get this problem: image 1246×864 77.2 KB

image 1606×1028 65.1 KB

image 1606×1028 65.1 KB

image 1130×878 67.1 KB

image 1130×878 67.1 KB

image 1246×864 77.2 KB

image 1246×864 77.2 KB

I have tried removing resetPose, and it just starts at position (0, 0), I have tried changing it to path.getStartingHolonomic() (since we use swerve) and there was no difference.

Is there a way to fix this problem?

To note: The red alliance path starts at the same exact position as the blue alliance path. (likely the cause of the error but I’m unaware of how to fix this.)
What exactly is the problem when on the red alliance?  Does the robot start in the right place (near barge) then drive into the reef? If so, what does the actual path the robot takes look like?

posts.name: Brian Weiss
posts.cooked: Both on the red and blue alliance, their starting pose is the exact same. But if its on the red alliance, its supposed to start on the red side when starting the auto.

posts.name: Miles Hua
posts.cooked: What version of pathplanner lib are you using? Our team had a similar issue that was resolved by updating to pathplanner 2025.2.1

posts.name: Brian Weiss
posts.cooked: This is what it looks like

posts.name: Brian Weiss
posts.cooked:
mhua:

What version of pathplanner lib are you using? Our team had a similar issue that was resolved by updating to pathplanner 2025.2.1

We are using PathPlanner 2025.2.4, I downgraded to 2025.2.1 and it still didn’t work

posts.name: Brian Weiss
posts.cooked:
The solution is as follows: in AutoBuilder.configure, when identifying a swap, always set it to false.

Update this to have a DeferredCommand so that it runs when actually called. Instead of at init.

Where we flip the path in the ChoreAuto function:

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: Be careful with this, since you’d then have to wait to run ChoreoAuto() until the driver station was connected.

posts.name: Brian Weiss
posts.cooked: Won’t the path default to the else statement if the driverstation isn’t connected, and so it will run the nonflipped path.

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: Yes, but that’s not a great idea because then you’re completely defeating the purpose of the flipping. If you call this command factory early enough, DriverStation.getAlliance() will never be valid during the method.

posts.name: Brian Weiss
posts.cooked: it’s only called when the command executes (new DeferredCommand()) so only when the autoChooser selects and the cmd is executed in robot.java, it will be run, where an alliance should’ve been chosen by then.

posts.name: Rishi Desai
posts.cooked: Is there a better way to do this?

posts.name: Rishi Desai
posts.cooked:
@Override public void robotInit() { // … all other robot initialization FollowPathCommand.warmupCommand().schedule(); }

put this in robot.java and you don’t need your by pass

posts.name: Rishi Desai
posts.cooked: You still need to set the Alliance Flipping to false in your autobuilder or else this doesn’t work.
